uniform_equicontinuous_of_continuity_mod:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/-- For a family of functions between (pseudo) metric spaces, a convenient way to prove
uniform equicontinuity is to show that all of the functions share a common *global* continuity
modulus. -/
theorem uniform_equicontinuous_of_continuity_modulus {ι : Type _} [pseudo_metric_space β] (b : exprℝ → exprℝ)
    (b_lim : tendsto b ((nhds) 0) ((nhds) 0)) (F : ι → β → α)
    (H : ∀ (x y : β) (i), dist (F i x) (F i y) ≤ b (dist x y)) : uniform_equicontinuous F :=
  by
  rw [metric.uniform_equicontinuous_iff]
  intro ε ε0
  rcases tendsto_nhds_nhds.1 b_lim ε ε0 with ⟨δ, δ0, hδ⟩
  refine' ⟨δ, δ0, fun x y hxy i => _⟩
  calc
    dist (F i x) (F i y) ≤ b (dist x y) := H x y i
    _ ≤ |b (dist x y)| := le_abs_self _
    _ = dist (b (dist x y)) 0 := by simp [real.dist_eq]
    _ < ε := hδ (by simpa only [real.dist_eq, tsub_zero, abs_dist] using hxy)
    
#align uniform_equicontinuous_of_continuity_modulus uniform_equicontinuous_of_continuity_modulus

/-- Characterization of uniform equicontinuity for families of functions taking values in a
(pseudo) metric space. -/
theorem uniform_equicontinuous_iff_right {ι : Type _} [uniform_space β] {F : ι → β → α} :
    uniform_equicontinuous F ↔
      ∀ ε > 0,
        «expr∀ᶠ in , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr∀ᶠ in , »"
          ((uniformity) β) (∀ i, dist (F i xy.1) (F i xy.2) < ε) :=
  uniformity_basis_dist.uniform_equicontinuous_iff_right
#align uniform_equicontinuous_iff_right uniform_equicontinuous_iff_right
uniform_equicontinuous_iff:
/-- Characterization of uniform equicontinuity for families of functions between
(pseudo) metric spaces. -/
theorem uniform_equicontinuous_iff {ι : Type _} [pseudo_metric_space β] {F : ι → β → α} :
    uniform_equicontinuous F ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ δ > 0, ∀ x y, dist x y < δ → ∀ i, dist (F i x) (F i y) < ε :=
  uniformity_basis_dist.uniform_equicontinuous_iff uniformity_basis_dist
#align uniform_equicontinuous_iff uniform_equicontinuous_iff
equicontinuous_of_continuity_modulus:

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/-- For a family of functions between (pseudo) metric spaces, a convenient way to prove
equicontinuity is to show that all of the functions share a common *global* continuity modulus. -/
theorem equicontinuous_of_continuity_modulus {ι : Type _} [pseudo_metric_space β] (b : exprℝ → exprℝ)
    (b_lim : tendsto b ((nhds) 0) ((nhds) 0)) (F : ι → β → α)
    (H : ∀ (x y : β) (i), dist (F i x) (F i y) ≤ b (dist x y)) : equicontinuous F :=
  (uniform_equicontinuous_of_continuity_modulus b b_lim F H).equicontinuous
#align equicontinuous_of_continuity_modulus equicontinuous_of_continuity_modulus
equicontinuous_at_of_continuity_modulus:

/-- For a family of functions to a (pseudo) metric spaces, a convenient way to prove
equicontinuity at a point is to show that all of the functions share a common *local* continuity
modulus. -/
theorem equicontinuous_at_of_continuity_modulus {ι : Type _} [topological_space β] {x₀ : β} (b : β → exprℝ)
    (b_lim : tendsto b ((nhds) x₀) ((nhds) 0)) (F : ι → β → α)
    (H :
      «expr∀ᶠ in , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr∀ᶠ in , »"
        ((nhds) x₀) (∀ i, dist (F i x₀) (F i x) ≤ b x)) :
    equicontinuous_at F x₀ := by
  rw [metric.equicontinuous_at_iff_right]
  intro ε ε0
  filter_upwards [b_lim (Iio_mem_nhds ε0), H] using fun x hx₁ hx₂ i => (hx₂ i).trans_lt hx₁
#align equicontinuous_at_of_continuity_modulus equicontinuous_at_of_continuity_modulus

equicontinuous_at_iff_pair:

/-- Reformulation of `equicontinuous_at_iff_pair` for families of functions taking values in a

protected theorem equicontinuous_at_iff_pair {ι : Type _} [topological_space β] {F : ι → β → α} {x₀ : β} :
    equicontinuous_at F x₀ ↔
      ∀ ε > 0, ∃ U ∈ (nhds) x₀, ∀ (x) (_ : x ∈ U) (x') (_ : x' ∈ U), ∀ i, dist (F i x) (F i x') < ε :=

  · intro ε hε

    exact fun x hx x' hx' => h _ hx _ hx'
  · intro U hU

    refine' Exists.imp (fun V => Exists.imp fun hV h => _) (H _ hε)
    exact fun x hx x' hx' i => hεU (h _ hx _ hx' i)
#align equicontinuous_at_iff_pair equicontinuous_at_iff_pair
equicontinuous_at_iff:
/-- Characterization of equicontinuity for families of functions between (pseudo) metric spaces. -/
theorem equicontinuous_at_iff {ι : Type _} [pseudo_metric_space β] {F : ι → β → α} {x₀ : β} :
    equicontinuous_at F x₀ ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ δ > 0, ∀ x, dist x x₀ < δ → ∀ i, dist (F i x₀) (F i x) < ε :=
  nhds_basis_ball.equicontinuous_at_iff uniformity_basis_dist
#align equicontinuous_at_iff equicontinuous_at_iff
